str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Neuter 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To buy. From agora; properly, to go to market, i.e. to purchase; specially, to redeem.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A potter. From keramos; a potter.
From ago; a field; genitive case, the country; specially, a farm, i.e. Hamlet.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A burial, burial place. Feminine from thapto; burial.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Apparently a primary word; foreign; by implication, a guest or entertainer.
